issue.title: [CF 1018] Who buffed me - is [AuraSource:Name] working?
issue.body:
Who buffed me - is [AuraSource:Name] working?

I want to identify and thank the *unknown* [caster] that buffed/healed/etc me.
I want to whisper to them....  Hey [caster], thank you for [spell]

My notification is not working correctly - the whisper fails - seemingly because it will not identify the [caster]

It is very erratic in identifying the caster - it frequently will not.
It will NOT work when I have myself targeted.
It will infrequently/occasionally work when I have the caster targeted (which defeats the point)
It will infrequently/occasionally work when I have something else targeted

Below is my attempt with TMW

---export---
^1^T^SType^Sbuff ^SName^SIncreasedStats ^SGUID^STMW:icon:1KNKRt9=OjuC ^SEvents^T ^N1^T ^SType^SAnnouncements ^SChannel^SWHISPER ^SLocation^S[AuraSource:Name] ^SText^SHey~`[AuraSource:Name],~`thanks~`for~`the~`[Spell] ^SEvent^SOnShow ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^SEnabled^B ^t^N71204^S~`~| ^Sicon^^
---end export---

I also tested this using 'SAY' to write variables to the screen.
The string in TMW is......
  "Hey [AuraSource:Name], thanks for the [Spell]"
    -- and it looked like this  --
  [Swallow] says: Hey  , thanks for the [Mark of the Wild]

Perhaps I am not using [AuraSource:Name] correctly, but I think I am...

I would be grateful for any assistance.
Thank you,
Steve

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. create a single icon as above
2. target someone OTHER THAN your friend
3. have your friend buff you with Mark of the WIld

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
--from TMW.toc--
## Version: 7.1.2

> Posted by CurseForge user swallow_area52 | Imported from CurseForge issue #1018 | Raw

comments.body:
The availability of the data is totally up to the WoW API. In this case, the person who applied the buff to you must have a valid unitID in order to be reported as the source of the aura.

If they're in your group, it will almost always work. If they aren't in your group, it will almost never work.

I have updated the description to better describe this behavior, but this is all I can do on the issue because it is out of my control.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

You can also use a Combat Event icon to do this, which will work a lot better, since the source of a combat event is always known.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
